title: Spinners mark emphatic win for Central Punjab 2nd XI
text:
Raza Ali Dar (3-23) and Zahid Mansoor (2-18) helped Central Punjab to win against Baluchistan by 57 runs in the National T20 2nd XI Tournament at National Stadium Karachi.

While batting first, Central Punjab posted a mammoth total of 198 runs on the scoreboard. Their spinners dominated the show for them in the second inning.

Nauman Anwar scored 62 runs off 36 deliveries with the help of six fours and four sixes to provide a solid start to Central Punjab. Mohammad Saad was the other prominent scorer for them with 66 runs.

Akbar ur Rehman took three wickets while conceding 31 runs in his four overs.

In reply, Baluchistan’s top-order batting got completely failed. Ibtisam Sheikh from the bottom batting line fought hard as he scored 46 runs off just 25 deliveries.

Raza and Mansoor were completely in strong knick as they both shared three wickets apiece.

In another match at NSK, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa beat Sindh by six wickets. Gohar Ali (49) and Nabi Gul (44) led KP to a successful run chase in 17.2 overs. Nabi struck a boundary and four sixes while Gohar smashed six boundaries and two maximums.

Ghulam Mudassar bagged three wickets while Hassan Khan managed to get a wicket for Sindh.

Earlier, Sindh while batting first scored 169-6 in 20 overs. Mohammad Waqas scored the highest 36 runs for Sindh laced with a boundary and two sixes. Rameez Aziz made 34 runs.

Sameen Gul, Arshad Iqbal, and Asif Afridi took a wicket each for KP.

description: Raza Ali Dar (3-23) and Zahid Mansoor (2-18) helped Central Punjab to win against Baluchistan by 57 runs in the National T20 2nd XI Tournament at National Stadium Karachi.
